alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 25 at 9:58AM AKDT until May 28 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE MATANUSKA VALLEY AND THE KNIK RIVER VALLEY... The National Weather Service in Anchorage has issued a Fire Weather Watch FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS, which is in effect from Friday morning through Saturday evening. * Winds...North 10 to 15 mph. * Timing...Friday morning through Saturday evening * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 to 25 percent. * Temperatures...Daytime highs in the mid 70s. * Location...Wasilla, Palmer, Matanuska Valley and Knik River Valley. * Impacts...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible.
info.instruction: A fire weather watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them to the public.
